fields.name: credentials
fields.description: Username and password to be used

fields.name: privateKey
fields.description: Private key to be used

records.name: AuthConfiguration
records.description:
Configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote
FTP server.

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: Supported FTP protocols

fields.name: host
fields.description: Target service URL

fields.name: port
fields.description: Port number of the remote service

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Authentication options

fields.name: username
fields.description: Username of the user

fields.name: password
fields.description: Password of the user

fields.name: path
fields.description: Relative file path for a newly-added file

fields.name: size
fields.description: Size of the file

fields.name: lastModifiedTimestamp
fields.description:
Last-modified timestamp of the file in
UNIX Epoch time

fields.name: name
fields.description: File name

fields.name: isFolder
fields.description: `true` if the file is a folder

fields.name: isFile
fields.description: `true` if the file is a file

fields.name: pathDecoded
fields.description:
Normalized absolute path of this file
within its file system

fields.name: extension
fields.description: Extension of the file name

fields.name: publicURIString
fields.description: Receiver as a URI String for public display

fields.name: fileType
fields.description: Type of the file

fields.name: isAttached
fields.description: `true` if the `fileObject` is attached

fields.name: isContentOpen
fields.description: `true` if someone reads/writes from/to this file

fields.name: isExecutable
fields.description: `true` if this file is executable

fields.name: isHidden
fields.description: `true` if this file is hidden

fields.name: isReadable
fields.description: `true` if this file can be read

fields.name: isWritable
fields.description: `true` if this file can be written

fields.name: depth
fields.description: Depth of the file name within its file system

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: URI scheme of the file

fields.name: uri
fields.description: Absolute URI of the file

fields.name: rootURI
fields.description: Root URI of the file system in which the file exists

fields.name: friendlyURI
fields.description: A "friendly path" is a path, which can be accessed without a password

fields.name: filePath
fields.description: Path of the file to be created or appended

fields.name: isFile
fields.description: `true` if the input type is a file

fields.name: fileContent
fields.description: The content read from the input file, if the input is a file

fields.name: textContent
fields.description: The input content, for other input types

fields.name: compressInput
fields.description: If true, input will be compressed before uploading

records.name: InputContent
records.description:
Configuration for the input given for `put` and `append` operations of
the FTP module.

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: Supported FTP protocols

fields.name: host
fields.description: Target service url

fields.name: port
fields.description: Port number of the remote service

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Authentication options

fields.name: path
fields.description: Remote FTP directory location

fields.name: fileNamePattern
fields.description: File name pattern that event need to trigger

fields.name: pollingInterval
fields.description: Periodic time interval to check new update

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path to the private key file

fields.name: password
fields.description: Private key password

records.name: PrivateKey
records.description: Configuration to read a privte key.

fields.name: addedFiles
fields.description: Array of `ftp:FileInfo` that represents newly added files

fields.name: deletedFiles
fields.description: Array of strings that contains deleted file names

records.name: WatchEvent
records.description:
This represents the latest status change of the server from the last
status change.

returnParameters.description: A byte stream from which the file can be read or `ftp:Error` in case of errors

remoteMethods.name: get
remoteMethods.description:
Retrieves the file content from a remote resource.
```ballerina
stream<byte[] & readonly, io:Error?>|ftp:Error channel
  = client->get(path);
```

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content to be written to the file in server

returnParameters.description:
`()` or else an `ftp:Error` if failed to establish
the communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: append
remoteMethods.description:
Appends the content to an existing file in an FTP server.
```ballerina
ftp:Error? response = client->append(path, channel);
```

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content to be written to the file in server

parameters.name: compressionType
parameters.description:
Type of the compression to be used, if
the file should be compressed before
uploading

returnParameters.description:
`()` or else an `ftp:Error` if failed to establish
the communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: put
remoteMethods.description:
Adds a file to an FTP server.
```ballerina
ftp:Error? response = client->put(path, channel);
```

returnParameters.description:
`()` or else an `ftp:Error` if failed to establish
the communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: mkdir
remoteMethods.description:
Creates a new direcotry in an FTP server.
```ballerina
ftp:Error? response = client->mkdir(path);
```

returnParameters.description:
`()` or else an `ftp:Error` if failed to establish
the communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: rmdir
remoteMethods.description:
Deletes an empty directory in an FTP server.
```ballerina
ftp:Error? response = client->rmdir(path);
```

returnParameters.description:
`()` or else an `ftp:Error` if failed to establish
the communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: rename
remoteMethods.description:
Renames a file or moves it to a new location within
the same FTP server.
```ballerina
ftp:Error? response = client->rename(origin, destination);
```

returnParameters.description:
The file size in bytes or an `ftp:Error` if
failed to establish the communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: size
remoteMethods.description:
Gets the size of a file resource.
```ballerina
int|ftp:Error response = client->size(path);
```

returnParameters.description:
An array of file names or an `ftp:Error` if failed to
establish the communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: list
remoteMethods.description:
Gets the file name list in a given folder.
```ballerina
ftp:FileInfo[]|ftp:Error response = client->list(path);
```

returnParameters.description:
`true` if given resource is a direcotry or an `ftp:Error` if
an error occurred while checking the path

remoteMethods.name: isDirectory
remoteMethods.description:
Checks if a given resource is a direcotry.
```ballerina
boolean|ftp:Error response = client->isDirectory(path);
```

returnParameters.description:
`()` or else an `ftp:Error` if failed to establish
the communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: delete
remoteMethods.description:
Deletes a file from an FTP server.
```ballerina
ftp:Error? response = client->delete(path);
```

returnParameters.description: `ftp:Error` in case of errors or `()` otherwise
A byte stream from which the file can be read or `ftp:Error` in case of errors

clients.name: Client
clients.description: Represents an FTP client that intracts with an FTP server

parameters.name: ftpService
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to register the listener

lifeCycleMethods.name: attach
lifeCycleMethods.description:
Binds a service to the `ftp:Listener`.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->attach(service1);
```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `ftp:Error` upon failure to initialize the listener
`()` or else an `error` upon failure to start the listener

parameters.name: ftpService
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to register the listener

methods.name: attach
methods.description:
Binds a service to the `ftp:Listener`.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->attach(service1);
```

parameters.name: ftpService
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to detach the service

methods.name: detach
methods.description:
Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the `ftp:Listener`.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->detach(service1);
```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: immediateStop
methods.description:
Stops the `ftp:Listener` forcefully.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->immediateStop();
```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: gracefulStop
methods.description:
Stops the `ftp:Listener` gracefully.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->gracefulStop();
```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
server

methods.name: poll
methods.description:
Poll new files from a FTP server.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->poll();
```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
server

methods.name: register
methods.description:
Register a FTP service in an FTP listener
server.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->register(ftpService, name);
```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `ftp:Error` upon failure to initialize the listener
`()` or else an `error` upon failure to start the listener

parameters.name: ftpService
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to detach the service

otherMethods.name: detach
otherMethods.description:
Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the `ftp:Listener`.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->detach(service1);
```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to stop the listener

otherMethods.name: immediateStop
otherMethods.description:
Stops the `ftp:Listener` forcefully.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->immediateStop();
```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to stop the listener

Stops the `ftp:Listener` gracefully.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->gracefulStop();
```

An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
server

otherMethods.name: poll
otherMethods.description:
Poll new files from a FTP server.
```ballerina
error? response = listener->poll();
```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
server

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description: Represents a service listener that monitors the FTP location.

errors.name: Error
errors.description: Defines the common error type for the module.

enums.name: Protocol
enums.description: Represents the set of protocols supported by the FTP listener and client.

modules.summary: This module provides an FTP/SFTP client and an FTP/SFTP server listener implementation to facilitate an FTP/SFTP connection connected to a remote location.

modules.description: This module provides an FTP/SFTP client and an FTP/SFTP server listener implementation to facilitate an FTP/SFTP connection connected to a remote location.

records.description:
Configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote
FTP server.

Configuration for the input given for `put` and `append` operations of
the FTP module.
Configuration to read a privte key.

This represents the latest status change of the server from the last
status change.

errors.description: Defines the common error type for the module.

clients.description: Represents an FTP client that intracts with an FTP server

listeners.description: Represents a service listener that monitors the FTP location.

enums.description: Represents the set of protocols supported by the FTP listener and client.
